Code of Conduct for Team Vindicta

This is how every member will behave, treat others, and work to grow our community and team

Mission Statement

Our mission is to compete at the highest levels of 40k tournament play. We seek to raise the standards of competitive Warhammer 40k in the Tri-State area, both on and off the table by treating the game as one would a sport. This requires levels of work and dedication to ourselves, our team and the game as a whole.

General Requirements for Team Members

  • 2 team games per week
  • 1 team event per month
  • 3 competitive events per quarter
  • Must be active in the 40k meta / community. This could include, but is not limited to;
    • paid memberships
    • patrons
    • warhammer discords
    • competitive facebook groups
    This is to ensure that you are able to keep plugged in to meta changes and will act as a gauge for levels of commitment. This includes being involved in the community and being aware of new releases, meta changes and general game updates. Examples include:
    • Vanguard Tactics
    • AoW DU
    • AoW
    • Tabletop Titans

Code of Conduct

  • Act in a professional manner during all events and treat all team members with respect, and treat all others as if they were your team members
  • Must be of clear mind, sober and be able to participate for all arounds of an event. There is no exception to this.
  • We can not control the meta, the rules, the people who show up to events, and the shifts that take place within the community. Complaining about the state of things will not change them. All members are expected to “adapt or die”. This includes adjusting armies, unit selection, paint schemes and anything else that may be required to ensure that you're able to perform at your best.
  • “Good” is a state of mind, and advancement towards higher levels of play requires time, effort and consistency. There is no shortcut, and you will lose games. How you approach those losses are the metrics for how you grow.
  • You will not lose 10 points for the unpainted army. How you achieve this is up to you.
  • Must bring your own ruler, enough dice and lucky object of choice.

Any breach of these Code of Conducts are grounds for immediate dismissal from the team, event, group, discord, etc.
